trans-unit.source: Applies To: Azure AD Graph API
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Azure AD Graph API

trans-unit.source: Represents an Azure AD user account.
trans-unit.target: Represents an Azure AD user account.

trans-unit.source: This topic provides information about the properties and navigation properties exposed by the <system>User</system> entity, as well as the operations, actions, and functions that you can call on it.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides information about the properties and navigation properties exposed by the <system>User</system> entity, as well as the operations, actions, and functions that you can call on it.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Namespace</embeddedLabel>: Microsoft.DirectoryServices for version 1.5 and newer, Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory for versions prior to 1.5.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Namespace</embeddedLabel>: Microsoft.DirectoryServices for version 1.5 and newer, Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ActiveDirectory for versions prior to 1.5.

trans-unit.source: The <system>User</system> entity has the following properties:
trans-unit.target: The <system>User</system> entity has the following properties:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> if the account is enabled; otherwise, <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> if the account is enabled; otherwise, <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: This property is required when a user is created.
trans-unit.target: This property is required when a user is created.

trans-unit.source: The licenses that are assigned to the user.
trans-unit.target: The licenses that are assigned to the user.

trans-unit.source: The plans that are assigned to the user.
trans-unit.target: The plans that are assigned to the user.

trans-unit.source: The city in which the user is located.
trans-unit.target: The city in which the user is located.

trans-unit.source: The country/region in which the user is located; for example, “US” or “UK”.
trans-unit.target: The country/region in which the user is located; for example, “US” or “UK”.

trans-unit.source: This property is not valid for users and always returns <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: This property is not valid for users and always returns <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The name for the department in which the user works.
trans-unit.target: The name for the department in which the user works.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> if this object was synced from the on-premises directory; otherwise, <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> if this object was synced from the on-premises directory; otherwise, <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The name displayed in the address book for the user.
trans-unit.target: The name displayed in the address book for the user.

trans-unit.source: This is usually the combination of the user's first name, middle initial and last name.
trans-unit.target: This is usually the combination of the user's first name, middle initial and last name.

trans-unit.source: This property is required when a user is created and it cannot be cleared during updates.
trans-unit.target: This property is required when a user is created and it cannot be cleared during updates.

trans-unit.source: The telephone number of the user's business fax machine.
trans-unit.target: The telephone number of the user's business fax machine.

trans-unit.source: The given name (first name) of the user.
trans-unit.target: The given name (first name) of the user.

trans-unit.source: Required if using a federated domain for the UPN
trans-unit.target: Required if using a federated domain for the UPN

trans-unit.source: This property is used to associate an on-premises Active Directory user account to their Azure AD user object.
trans-unit.target: This property is used to associate an on-premises Active Directory user account to their Azure AD user object.

trans-unit.source: This property must be specified when creating a new user account in the Graph if you are using a federated domain for the user’s <system>userPrincipalName</system> (UPN) property.
trans-unit.target: This property must be specified when creating a new user account in the Graph if you are using a federated domain for the user’s <system>userPrincipalName</system> (UPN) property.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>$</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>_</embeddedLabel> characters cannot be used when specifying this property.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>$</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>_</embeddedLabel> characters cannot be used when specifying this property.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the last time at which the object was synced with the on-premises directory; for example: "2013-02-16T03:04:54Z"
trans-unit.target: Indicates the last time at which the object was synced with the on-premises directory; for example: "2013-02-16T03:04:54Z"

trans-unit.source: The SMTP address for the user, for example, "jeff@contoso.onmicrosoft.com".
trans-unit.target: The SMTP address for the user, for example, "jeff@contoso.onmicrosoft.com".

trans-unit.source: The mail alias for the user.
trans-unit.target: The mail alias for the user.

trans-unit.source: This property must be specified when a user is created.
trans-unit.target: This property must be specified when a user is created.

trans-unit.source: The primary cellular telephone number for the user.
trans-unit.target: The primary cellular telephone number for the user.

trans-unit.source: The unique identifier for the user.
trans-unit.target: The unique identifier for the user.

trans-unit.source: A string that identifies the object type.
trans-unit.target: A string that identifies the object type.

trans-unit.source: For users the value is always “User”.
trans-unit.target: For users the value is always “User”.

trans-unit.source: Contains the on-premises security identifier (SID) for the user that was synchronized from on-premises to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Contains the on-premises security identifier (SID) for the user that was synchronized from on-premises to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: A list of additional email addresses for the user; for example: ["bob@contoso.com", "Robert@fabrikam.com"].
trans-unit.target: A list of additional email addresses for the user; for example: ["bob@contoso.com", "Robert@fabrikam.com"].

trans-unit.source: When filtering, must be used with the “any” $filter expression.
trans-unit.target: When filtering, must be used with the “any” $filter expression.

trans-unit.source: Specifies password policies for the user.
trans-unit.target: Specifies password policies for the user.

trans-unit.source: This value is an enumeration with one possible value being “DisableStrongPassword”, which allows weaker passwords than the default policy to be specified.
trans-unit.target: This value is an enumeration with one possible value being “DisableStrongPassword”, which allows weaker passwords than the default policy to be specified.

trans-unit.source: The two may be specified together; for example: "DisablePasswordExpiration, DisableStrongPassword".
trans-unit.target: The two may be specified together; for example: "DisablePasswordExpiration, DisableStrongPassword".

trans-unit.source: Specifies the password profile for the user.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the password profile for the user.

trans-unit.source: The profile contains the user’s password.
trans-unit.target: The profile contains the user’s password.

trans-unit.source: This property is required when a user is created.
trans-unit.target: This property is required when a user is created.

trans-unit.source: The password in the profile must satisfy minimum requirements as specified by the <system>passwordPolicies</system> property.
trans-unit.target: The password in the profile must satisfy minimum requirements as specified by the <system>passwordPolicies</system> property.

trans-unit.source: By default, a strong password is required.
trans-unit.target: By default, a strong password is required.

trans-unit.source: For information about the constraints that must be satisfied for a strong password, see <legacyBold>Password policy</legacyBold> under <externalLink><linkText>Change your password</linkText><linkUri>http://onlinehelp.microsoft.com/office365-enterprises/ff637578.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> in the Microsoft Office 365 help pages.
trans-unit.target: For information about the constraints that must be satisfied for a strong password, see <legacyBold>Password policy</legacyBold> under <externalLink><linkText>Change your password</linkText><linkUri>http://onlinehelp.microsoft.com/office365-enterprises/ff637578.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> in the Microsoft Office 365 help pages.

trans-unit.source: The office location in the user's place of business.
trans-unit.target: The office location in the user's place of business.

trans-unit.source: The postal code for the user's postal address.
trans-unit.target: The postal code for the user's postal address.

trans-unit.source: The postal code is specific to the user's country/region.
trans-unit.target: The postal code is specific to the user's country/region.

trans-unit.source: In the United States of America, this attribute contains the ZIP code.
trans-unit.target: In the United States of America, this attribute contains the ZIP code.

trans-unit.source: The preferred language for the user.
trans-unit.target: The preferred language for the user.

trans-unit.source: Should follow ISO 639-1 Code; for example "en-US".
trans-unit.target: Should follow ISO 639-1 Code; for example "en-US".

trans-unit.source: The plans that are provisioned for the user.
trans-unit.target: The plans that are provisioned for the user.

trans-unit.source: A collection of error details that are preventing this user from being provisioned successfully.
trans-unit.target: A collection of error details that are preventing this user from being provisioned successfully.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the voice over IP (VOIP) session initiation protocol (SIP) address for the user.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the voice over IP (VOIP) session initiation protocol (SIP) address for the user.

trans-unit.source: The state or province in the user's address.
trans-unit.target: The state or province in the user's address.

trans-unit.source: The street address of the user's place of business.
trans-unit.target: The street address of the user's place of business.

trans-unit.source: The user's surname (family name or last name).
trans-unit.target: The user's surname (family name or last name).

trans-unit.source: The primary telephone number of the user's place of business.
trans-unit.target: The primary telephone number of the user's place of business.

trans-unit.source: A thumbnail photo to be displayed for the user.
trans-unit.target: A thumbnail photo to be displayed for the user.

trans-unit.source: A two letter country code (ISO standard 3166).
trans-unit.target: A two letter country code (ISO standard 3166).

trans-unit.source: Required for users that will be assigned licenses due to legal requirement to check for availability of services in countries.
trans-unit.target: Required for users that will be assigned licenses due to legal requirement to check for availability of services in countries.

trans-unit.source: The user principal name (UPN) of the user.
trans-unit.target: The user principal name (UPN) of the user.

trans-unit.source: The UPN is an Internet-style login name for the user based on the Internet standard RFC 822.
trans-unit.target: The UPN is an Internet-style login name for the user based on the Internet standard RFC 822.

trans-unit.source: By convention, this should map to the user's email name.
trans-unit.target: By convention, this should map to the user's email name.

trans-unit.source: The general format is alias@domain, where domain must be present in the tenant’s collection of verified domains.
trans-unit.target: The general format is alias@domain, where domain must be present in the tenant’s collection of verified domains.

trans-unit.source: This property is required when a user is created.
trans-unit.target: This property is required when a user is created.

trans-unit.source: The verified domains for the tenant can be accessed from the <system>VerifiedDomains</system> property of <link xlink:href="392e345d-b226-4b34-bd88-fcd28df01474" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">TenantDetail</link>.
trans-unit.target: The verified domains for the tenant can be accessed from the <system>VerifiedDomains</system> property of <link xlink:href="392e345d-b226-4b34-bd88-fcd28df01474" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">TenantDetail</link>.

trans-unit.source: For example, for contoso.onmicosoft.com, tenant detail can be read by performing a GET to the following URL: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.onmicrosoft.com/tenantDetails?api-version=1.5.
trans-unit.target: For example, for contoso.onmicosoft.com, tenant detail can be read by performing a GET to the following URL: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.onmicrosoft.com/tenantDetails?api-version=1.5.

trans-unit.source: A string value that can be used to classify user types in your directory, such as “Member” and “Guest”.
trans-unit.target: A string value that can be used to classify user types in your directory, such as “Member” and “Guest”.

trans-unit.source: (Only User and Contact objects are supported.)
trans-unit.target: (Only User and Contact objects are supported.)

trans-unit.source: The user or contact that is this user’s manager.
trans-unit.target: The user or contact that is this user’s manager.

trans-unit.source: (Only User and Contact objects are supported.)
trans-unit.target: (Only User and Contact objects are supported.)

trans-unit.source: The users and contacts that report to the user.
trans-unit.target: The users and contacts that report to the user.

trans-unit.source: (The users and contacts that have their manager property set to this user.)
trans-unit.target: (The users and contacts that have their manager property set to this user.)

trans-unit.source: (Only Group and Role objects are supported.)
trans-unit.target: (Only Group and Role objects are supported.)

trans-unit.source: The groups and roles that the user is a member of.
trans-unit.target: The groups and roles that the user is a member of.

trans-unit.source: Devices that are owned by the user.
trans-unit.target: Devices that are owned by the user.

trans-unit.source: The permissions associated with the user.
trans-unit.target: The permissions associated with the user.

trans-unit.source: The property is renamed to <system>oauth2PermissionGrants</system> and the <system>Permission</system> entity is renamed to <link xlink:href="190a3538-80be-4ce4-8250-9bd6f26b7136" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OAuth2PermissionGrant</link> in version 1.5 and newer.
trans-unit.target: The property is renamed to <system>oauth2PermissionGrants</system> and the <system>Permission</system> entity is renamed to <link xlink:href="190a3538-80be-4ce4-8250-9bd6f26b7136" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OAuth2PermissionGrant</link> in version 1.5 and newer.

trans-unit.source: See the documentation for <system>OAuth2PermssionGrant</system> for documentation of the <system>Permission</system> entity type.
trans-unit.target: See the documentation for <system>OAuth2PermssionGrant</system> for documentation of the <system>Permission</system> entity type.

trans-unit.source: Devices that are registered for the user.
trans-unit.target: Devices that are registered for the user.

trans-unit.source: Directory objects that were created by the user.
trans-unit.target: Directory objects that were created by the user.

trans-unit.source: Directory objects that are owned by the user.
trans-unit.target: Directory objects that are owned by the user.

trans-unit.source: The set of applications that this user is assigned to.
trans-unit.target: The set of applications that this user is assigned to.

trans-unit.source: The set of applications that are granted consent to impersonate this user.
trans-unit.target: The set of applications that are granted consent to impersonate this user.

trans-unit.source: <system>User</system> also inherits additional properties from <link xlink:href="b0c66543-c74f-4e46-b617-76f9b780e99e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DirectoryObject</link>; however, this property is not valid for users.
trans-unit.target: <system>User</system> also inherits additional properties from <link xlink:href="b0c66543-c74f-4e46-b617-76f9b780e99e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DirectoryObject</link>; however, this property is not valid for users.

trans-unit.source: If a request for this property is sent, a <system>400 Bad Request</system> response is returned.
trans-unit.target: If a request for this property is sent, a <system>400 Bad Request</system> response is returned.

trans-unit.source: For information about the primitive types exposed by the EDM, see <externalLink><linkText>Entity Data Model: Primitive Data Types</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee382832.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the primitive types exposed by the EDM, see <externalLink><linkText>Entity Data Model: Primitive Data Types</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee382832.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows how to address the user resource set, which spans all the users in the directory; an individual user; and the navigation properties of a user.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows how to address the user resource set, which spans all the users in the directory; an individual user; and the navigation properties of a user.

trans-unit.source: Users can be addressed either by Object ID or by their User Principal Name (UPN).
trans-unit.target: Users can be addressed either by Object ID or by their User Principal Name (UPN).

trans-unit.source: The examples in the table use the tenant domain to address the tenant.
trans-unit.target: The examples in the table use the tenant domain to address the tenant.

trans-unit.source: For other ways of addressing the tenant, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.
trans-unit.target: For other ways of addressing the tenant, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.

trans-unit.source: Remove the “$links” segment of the navigation property URL to return the objects referenced by a navigation property rather than links to them.
trans-unit.target: Remove the “$links” segment of the navigation property URL to return the objects referenced by a navigation property rather than links to them.

trans-unit.source: This mode of addressing can be used for read operations only.
trans-unit.target: This mode of addressing can be used for read operations only.

trans-unit.source: Users or their navigation properties can also be addressed as generic directory objects by replacing “users” with “directoryObjects” in the URL and specifying the user’s object ID.
trans-unit.target: Users or their navigation properties can also be addressed as generic directory objects by replacing “users” with “directoryObjects” in the URL and specifying the user’s object ID.

trans-unit.source: For more comprehensive information about querying directory objects, see <link xlink:href="3f3199df-de7d-49ff-92d2-58c8e3e9c9e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Common Queries</link> and <link xlink:href="d53ed232-0799-4749-a33e-0b622ec0f9c1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Differential Query</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more comprehensive information about querying directory objects, see <link xlink:href="3f3199df-de7d-49ff-92d2-58c8e3e9c9e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Common Queries</link> and <link xlink:href="d53ed232-0799-4749-a33e-0b622ec0f9c1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Differential Query</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following operations are supported on users (the HTTP method used for each is in parentheses):
trans-unit.target: The following operations are supported on users (the HTTP method used for each is in parentheses):

trans-unit.source: The following operations are supported on user navigation properties; not all operations are supported on every navigation property.
trans-unit.target: The following operations are supported on user navigation properties; not all operations are supported on every navigation property.

trans-unit.source: The following actions and functions may be called on users:
trans-unit.target: The following actions and functions may be called on users:

trans-unit.source: <system>assignUserLicense</system> to assign and/or remove a specified list of licenses from a user.
trans-unit.target: <system>assignUserLicense</system> to assign and/or remove a specified list of licenses from a user.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="376b9965-8787-4bbd-b0d4-f05bb072ab12" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">checkMemberGroups</link> to check the user’s membership in a list of groups.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="376b9965-8787-4bbd-b0d4-f05bb072ab12" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">checkMemberGroups</link> to check the user’s membership in a list of groups.

trans-unit.source: <system>getAvailableExtensionProperties</system> to return a list of the extension properties that have been registered for a user.
trans-unit.target: <system>getAvailableExtensionProperties</system> to return a list of the extension properties that have been registered for a user.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="64ba0b59-8ae8-4c7b-b3ce-61f417318b59" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">getMemberGroups</link> to return a list of the groups that a user is a member of.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="64ba0b59-8ae8-4c7b-b3ce-61f417318b59" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">getMemberGroups</link> to return a list of the groups that a user is a member of.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="eb34602a-15b7-4c73-a632-003fe108184b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">isMemberOf</link> to check whether a user is a member of a specified group.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="eb34602a-15b7-4c73-a632-003fe108184b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">isMemberOf</link> to check whether a user is a member of a specified group.

trans-unit.source: The principal that performs the operation must be in an administrator role that has permissions to modify user objects to send PATCH, POST, PUT or DELETE requests or to invoke any action that modifies the user.
trans-unit.target: The principal that performs the operation must be in an administrator role that has permissions to modify user objects to send PATCH, POST, PUT or DELETE requests or to invoke any action that modifies the user.

trans-unit.source: It must be in a role that has permissions to read user objects to send GET requests or to invoke functions on the user.
trans-unit.target: It must be in a role that has permissions to read user objects to send GET requests or to invoke functions on the user.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyBold>Remarks</legacyBold> section for additional information about performing operations on users.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyBold>Remarks</legacyBold> section for additional information about performing operations on users.

trans-unit.source: At a minimum, you must specify the following properties when creating a user: <system>accountEnabled</system>, <system>displayName</system>, <system>mailNickName</system>, <system>passwordProfile</system>, and <system>userPrincipalName</system>.
trans-unit.target: At a minimum, you must specify the following properties when creating a user: <system>accountEnabled</system>, <system>displayName</system>, <system>mailNickName</system>, <system>passwordProfile</system>, and <system>userPrincipalName</system>.

trans-unit.source: The password specified in the <system>passwordProfile</system> property must meet the tenant’s password complexity requirements.
trans-unit.target: The password specified in the <system>passwordProfile</system> property must meet the tenant’s password complexity requirements.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <system>passwordPolicies</system> property.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <system>passwordPolicies</system> property.

trans-unit.source: In version 2013-11-08 and newer, the <system>immutableId</system> property must be specified when creating a new user account in the Graph if you are using a federated domain for the user’s <system>userPrincipalName</system> (UPN) property.
trans-unit.target: In version 2013-11-08 and newer, the <system>immutableId</system> property must be specified when creating a new user account in the Graph if you are using a federated domain for the user’s <system>userPrincipalName</system> (UPN) property.

trans-unit.source: The <system>displayName</system> property cannot be cleared on updates.
trans-unit.target: The <system>displayName</system> property cannot be cleared on updates.

trans-unit.source: This is to prevent the user’s password from being displayed.
trans-unit.target: This is to prevent the user’s password from being displayed.

trans-unit.source: You can reset the user’s password by updating the <system>passwordProfile</system> property.
trans-unit.target: You can reset the user’s password by updating the <system>passwordProfile</system> property.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the standard addressing available for all directory entities, users may be addressed by using the <system>userPrincipalName</system> property; for example, https://graph.windows.net/contoso.onmicrosoft.com/users/john@contoso.onmicrosoft.com?api-version=1.5.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the standard addressing available for all directory entities, users may be addressed by using the <system>userPrincipalName</system> property; for example, https://graph.windows.net/contoso.onmicrosoft.com/users/john@contoso.onmicrosoft.com?api-version=1.5.

trans-unit.source: For more information operations on users including examples, see <link xlink:href="04d1e2e3-06b6-49c5-9f8c-514742f24b3f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on Users</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information operations on users including examples, see <link xlink:href="04d1e2e3-06b6-49c5-9f8c-514742f24b3f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on Users</link>.
